column4: I'm trying to install java.  The instructions say to use su. You learn something new
Java is saying it's having dependency problems... :-S
I went back to synaptic and it says I have 2 broken packages in my system.  How do I fix them?
It said to search with the term "broken" and when I did it came up with "Synaptic Package Manager" and "Klean Sweep" (which is not installed)
Great.  I broke Ubuntu in less than 24 hours
It still lists the same 2 packages under "broken"
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
OK.  It immediately went back to the command line.  BTW what dies sudo stand for?
But does it stand for something?
DO as in to do or doing something?
Java installed OK, even with the errors it gave me
Well I'm about to run Azureus, so that'll tell me if the runtimes are installed but the browser plugin is definitely working
everything is working fine.  I've read that Brasero is a good burning software but it's not in the software packages.  Do I install that from their website?
Thanks, that helps!  Off to search for more software then...
